intro: Rinorea camptoneura, commonly known as the zigzag rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rinorea camptoneura is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
